revised_title: Electromotive Properties of the Leaf of Dionaea in Excited and Unexcited States
tldr: The author examines the electromotive properties of the Dionaea leaf in both excited and unexcited states. They discuss recent research on plant electricity and explore the distribution of electrical tension on the leaf's surface. The study also investigates the electrical phenomena resulting from excitation and the mechanisms behind the leaf's movement.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Physiology
